Hello,

I'm would like to advise you an open source project we created:
ht=
tp://junitscenario.sourceforge.net/

JUnitScenario is tool to simulate real=
 life usage of applications. It
allows you to describe scenarios that are c=
omposed of unit tests calls
and simulate several users following those scen=
arios.

You have less options than tools like JUnitPerf but it's very easy =
to
make it work... just write an xml file like this:
<scenario name=3D"cash=
ier" users=3D"20" loops=3D"500">
 <task JUnitClass=3D"org.mybank.MyFirstTes=
t"
JUnitMethod=3D"testCreateAccount" wait=3D"10"/>
 <task JUnitClass=3D"org=
.mybank.MyFirstTest"
JUnitMethod=3D"testDipositMoney" wait=3D"10"/>
 <task =
JUnitClass=3D"org.mybank.MyFirstTest"
JUnitMethod=3D"testWithdrawMoney" wai=
t=3D"50"/>
</scenario>

It doesn't have all the options of JMeter or JUnitP=
erf but it allows
anyone to create unit tests in 10 minutes without having =
to write lots
of files.. and there is nothing to compile :)

-- 
St=E9phane=
 TRAUMAT
scub.net

subject: Re: [junit] Experience with LoadTesting using JUnit?
